titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Oversize Ms. Codex 615: De planctu naturae.

availability.licence: These images and the content of Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts Oversize Ms. Codex 615: De planctu naturae. are free of known copyright restrictions and in the public domain. See the Creative Commons Public Domain Mark page for usage details, http://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/mark/1.0/.

notesStmt.note: Title and attribution from front cover: Alanus deplanctu naturae.

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: The plaint of nature, an ethical treatise on human failings in prose and verse, modeled on the De consolatione philosophiae of Boethius. Many contemporary marginal and interlinear notes throughout.

supportDesc.extent: 54 leaves : 299 x 228 (174 x 120) mm. bound to 290 x 227 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Paper, 54; [1-54], modern foliation in pencil, upper right recto.

layoutDesc.layout: Written in 22 long lines; frame-ruled in ink; prickings visible.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in a Gothic cursive script in the hand of Johannes de Polna (colophon f. 54v).

decoDesc.decoNote: Rubricated, with paragraph markers and capitals stroked in red ink; simple 2-line red initials, one with a grotesque face (f. 24r); several manicules (f. 15r, 21r, 28r, 31r, 42v).
Decorated initial, Initial D, Grotesque face, f. 24r

binding.p: Contemporary limp vellum; dry and brittle.

origin.p: Completed in Bohemia on 22 April 1365 (nearest weekday after Quasimodogeniti, the Octave of Easter, f. 54v).

history.provenance: Formerly held in the library of Stift Admont, the Benedictine monastery in the town of Admont, Styria, Austria (number 478, spine and inside upper cover) (Wichner).

Sold by Stift Admont to antiquarian bookdealer Brecher (Brno, modern Czech Republic) in 1938 (inscription in Wichner 1888 catalog); Z. Stelle f. Denkmalschutz stamp, indicating export license granted by the Austrian Bundesdenkmalamt, inside lower cover (Christoph Egger, Institut fuer Oesterreichische Geschichtsforschung).
